Class FileUtilities

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.griefed.serverpackcreator.utilities.common.FileUtilities

  • @Component
public final class FileUtilities
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility-class revolving around various file-interactions.

    • Method Detail

      • replaceFile

        public boolean replaceFile(java.io.File sourceFile,
                           java.io.File destinationFile)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Move a file from source to destination, and replace the destination file if it exists.
        Parameters:
        sourceFile - The source file.
        destinationFile - The destination file to be replaced by the source file.
        Returns:
        Boolean. Returns true if the file was sucessfully replaced.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if an error occurs when the file is moved.

      • unzipArchive

        public void unzipArchive(java.lang.String zipFile,
                         java.lang.String destinationDirectory)
        Unzips the downloaded modpack ZIP-archive to the specified directory.
        Parameters:
        zipFile - String. The path to the ZIP-archive which we want to unzip.
        destinationDirectory - The directory into which the ZIP-archive will be unzipped into.

      • checkFileType

        public FileUtilities.FileType checkFileType(java.lang.String file)
        Check the given file for its type, whether it is a regular file, a Windows link or a UNIX symlink.
        Parameters:
        file - The file to check
        Returns:
        The type of the given file. Either FileUtilities.FileType.FILE, FileUtilities.FileType.LINK or FileUtilities.FileType.SYMLINK

      • checkFileType

        public FileUtilities.FileType checkFileType(java.io.File file)
        Check the given file for its type, whether it is a regular file, a Windows link or a UNIX symlink.
        Parameters:
        file - The file to check
        Returns:
        The type of the given file. Either FileUtilities.FileType.FILE, FileUtilities.FileType.LINK or FileUtilities.FileType.SYMLINK

      • isLink

        public boolean isLink(java.lang.String file)
        Check if the given file is a UNIX symlink or Windows lnk.
        Parameters:
        file - The file to check.
        Returns:
        true if the given file is a UNIX symlink or Windows lnk.

      • isLink

        public boolean isLink(java.io.File file)
        Check if the given file is a UNIX symlink or Windows lnk.
        Parameters:
        file - The file to check.
        Returns:
        true if the given file is a UNIX symlink or Windows lnk.

      • resolveLink

        public java.lang.String resolveLink(java.lang.String link)
                             throws InvalidFileTypeException,
                                    java.io.IOException
        Resolve a given link/symlink to its source.
        Parameters:
        link - The link you want to resolve.
        Returns:
        Path to the source of the link. If the specified file is not a link, the path to the passed file is returned.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the link could not be parsed.
        InvalidFileTypeException - if the specified file is neither a file, lnk nor symlink.

      • resolveLink

        public java.lang.String resolveLink(java.io.File link)
                             throws java.io.IOException,
                                    InvalidFileTypeException
        Resolve a given link/symlink to its source.
        Parameters:
        link - The link you want to resolve.
        Returns:
        Path to the source of the link. If the specified file is not a link, the path to the passed file is returned.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the link could not be parsed.
        InvalidFileTypeException - if the specified file is neither a file, lnk nor symlink.

      • checkPermissions

        public boolean checkPermissions(java.lang.String fileOrDirectory)
                         throws java.nio.file.InvalidPathException
        Check the given file or directory for read- and write-permission.
        Parameters:
        fileOrDirectory - File or directory.
        Returns:
        true if both read- and write-permissions are set.
        Throws:
        java.nio.file.InvalidPathException - if the path string cannot be converted to a Path.

      • checkPermissions

        public boolean checkPermissions(java.io.File fileOrDirectory)
                         throws java.nio.file.InvalidPathException
        Check the given file or directory for read- and write-permission.
        Parameters:
        fileOrDirectory - File or directory.
        Returns:
        true if both read- and write-permissions are set.
        Throws:
        java.nio.file.InvalidPathException - if a Path object cannot be constructed from the abstract path (see FileSystem.getPath)

      • checkPermissions

        public boolean checkPermissions(java.nio.file.Path fileOrDirectory)
        Check the given file or directory for read- and write-permission.
        Parameters:
        fileOrDirectory - File or directory.
        Returns:
        true if both read- and write-permissions are set.
